STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
July 3, 2024
Julie Waldron
CHEBOYGAN/PRESQUE ISLE COUNTY DHHS
827 S HURON ST,
CHEBOYGAN, MI, 49721-2209
Re: License #: CP160201035
Dear Ms. Waldron:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
06/12/2024. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Samantha Way, Area Manager, at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Doug Turrill, Licensing Consultant
701 S. Elmwood
Traverse City MI. 49684
enclosure
2

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CPA Rule 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy
• (1) An agency's medical and dental care policy
must, include all the following:
• (e) A dental examination must be
completed within 3 months before entry
into foster care or an initial dental
examination must be completed not
more than 90 calendar days after entry
into a foster care out-of-home
placement. A child entering foster care
under 1 year of age must have an initial
dental exam within 3 months of his or
her first birthday.
Two of three files reviewed documented late dental exams.
FOM 722-08D Treatment Plans
Once completed and approved, the caseworker must
obtain signatures from the following individuals, as
applicable:
• Caseworker. • Supervisor. • Second line supervisor,
when siblings in care are placed apart. • Parents who
are a member of a participating household. • Youth
2

ages 14 and older. • Foster parents, relative
caregivers, and unrelated court ordered caregivers
One of three files reviewed contained one treatment plan that was signed more than
thirty days from the date of the service plan. Therefore, the signature page was not
uploaded into the electronic case record within 30 days of the report date.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Rule 400.12415 (a) Incident reports. Discussed the requirement that
incidents reports are to be submitted to the consultant. Only those
incidents named under the rule are to be submitted.
• DCWL review of Corrective Action Plans (CAP). The agency was
informed that starting January 1, 2024, interim and renewal audit CAP's
will be reviewed with the agency at three months and six months. The
assigned Consultant for the agency will work with the agency in
conducting CAP reviews. This process for special investigation CAP
reviews was implemented previously.
• Rule 400.12209 (2) (a) Orientation and Training. The agency was
informed that all the training requirements listed under (2) (a) are required
yearly for foster care workers carrying a caseload as well as for
supervisors who may be carrying a caseload.
V. CONSULTATION
Consultation was not requested or required at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
3

The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrators Assessment was reviewed. The agency was not required
to submit a CAP during the licensing year therefore a CAP was not addressed in
the assessment. The assessment did note however that ongoing review of
previous CAP's has helped the agency to maintain compliance. The assessment
identified barriers such as staff shortages as well as staff having to spend time
uploading documents, extra parenting time duties, and transportation.
Financial Overview
N/A
Staff Interviews
Staff reported liking working for the agency and feel supported by their supervisor
and the agency administration. Staff feel they are part of a supportive team that
works well together.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency is a located in a modern local DHHS office. The facility has adequate
office space and is well maintained. CHRI documents were stored securely.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
Safety Alert #1: The home was found to have a gun cabinet with a glass door and
firearms were not trigger locked.
Resolution: The agency provided the home with trigger locks which were installed
the day the home was notified of the concern and safety locks provided. The agency
initiated a special evaluation regarding the concern. Photos of the trigger locked
firearms were provided.
4

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
_________________July 1, 2024_______________________
Douglas W Turrill Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
July 3, 2024
________________________________________
Samantha Way Date
